text: (upbeat music plays)
- [Narrator] They're spectacular.

- [Announcer] To mention
that with one of the goals
of the weekends,

- [Narrator] They combine
strength and technique.
- [Announcer] That is a rocket.

- [Narrator] Oh, they push
goalkeepers and goal nets
to breaking point.
- [Announcer] Dynamite.
- [Narrator] Shot speed.

The new Bundesliga Match
Fact, powered by AWS,

makes the speed of shots
transparent and comparable.

It's measured right at
the beginning of a shot,
when the ball reaches its highest speed.
Take this goal from Serhou Guirassy,

where the ball flew at
115 kilometers an hour.
- [Announcer] Guirassy!

- [Narrator] Shot speed can
be used to form rankings,

showing which players have
reached the fastest shot speed
on a single match day, or during a season.

Like Jan-Niklas Beste
here, who scored a stunner
at 104 kilometers an hour.

- [Announcer] And look at
that, Jan-Niklas Beste.

- [Narrator] Shot speed
is a crucial factor
to beating the goalkeeper.

In this case, Kevin
Stoger beats Gregor Kobel
with a shot of 118 kilometers an hour,

which catapults him to
the top of the rankings.

- [Announcer] And Kevin
Stoger shot is a rocket.
It is thunderous from Kevin Stoger,

- [Narrator] But the new
match fact also recognizes
the goalkeeper's achievement
when he saves a high speed shot.
Here Marcel Chun fends off

a powerful 124 kilometers an
hour drive from Granit Xhaka.
- [Announcer] Xhaka, touched over by Chun.

- [Narrator] Shot speed is
another fascinating Match Fact,

providing yet more fruit
for lively discussion
for Bundesliga fans and experts alike.
(crowd cheers)
